.class.tip: Selects all elements with the given class.

element.tip: Selects all elements with the given tag name.

#id.tip: Selects a single element with the given id attribute.

selector1, selectorN....tip: Selects the combined results of all the specified selectors.

topics.title: Hierarchy
topics.desc: parent > child, ancestor descendant, prev + next, prev~siblings

parent > child.tip: Selects all direct child elements specified by "child" of elements specified by "parent".

ancestor descendant.tip: Selects all elements that are descendants of a given ancestor.

prev + next.tip: Selects all next elements matching "next" that are immediately preceded by a sibling "prev".

prev~siblings.tip: Selects all sibling elements that follow after the "prev" element, have the same parent, and match the filtering "siblings" selector.

:animated.tip: Select all elements that are in the progress of an animation at the time the selector is run.

:eq().tip: Select the element at index n within the matched set.

:first.tip: Selects the first matched DOM element.

:gt().tip: Select all elements at an index greater than index within the matched set.

:header.tip: Selects all elements that are headers, like h1, h2, h3 and so on.

:last().tip: Selects all elements of the specified language.

:lt().tip: Select all elements at an index less than index within the matched set.

:not().tip: Selects all elements that do not match the given selector.

:odd.tip: Selects odd elements, zero-indexed. See also even.

:root.tip: Selects the element that is the root of the document.

:target.tip: Selects the target element indicated by the fragment identifier of the document's URI.

:contains().tip: Select all elements that contain the specified text.

:empty.tip: Select all elements that have no children (including text nodes).

:has().tip: Selects elements which contain at least one element that matches the specified selector.

:parent.tip: Select all elements that have at least one child node (either an element or text).

:hidden.tip: Selects all elements that are hidden.

:visible.tip: Selects all elements that are visible.

[name|=\"value\"].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value either equal to a given string or starting with that string followed by a hyphen (-).

[name*=\"value\"].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value containing a given substring.

[name~=\"value\"].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value containing a given word, delimited by spaces.

[name$=\"value\"].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value ending exactly with a given string. The comparison is case sensitive.

[name=\"value\"].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value exactly equal to a certain value.

[name!=\"value\"].tip: Select elements that either don't have the specified attribute, or do have the specified attribute but not with a certain value.

[name].tip: Selects elements that have the specified attribute with a value beginning exactly with a given string.

[name=\"value\"][name2=\"value2\"].tip: Matches elements that match all of the specified attribute filters.

:first-child.tip: Selects all elements that are the first child of their parent.

:first-of-type.tip: Selects all elements that are the first among siblings of the same element name.

:last-child.tip: Selects all elements that are the last child of their parent.

:last-of-type.tip: Selects all elements that are the last among siblings of the same element name.

:nth-child().tip: Selects all elements that are the nth-child of their parent.

:nth-last-child().tip: Selects all elements that are the nth-child of their parent, counting from the last element to the first.

:nth-of-type().tip: Selects all elements that are the nth child of their parent in relation to siblings with the same element name.

:only-child.tip: Selects all elements that are the only child of their parent.

:only-of-type().tip: Selects all elements that have no siblings with the same element name.

:button.tip: Selects all button elements and elements of type button.

:checkbox.tip: Selects all elements of type checkbox.

:checked.tip: Matches all elements that are checked or selected.

:disabled.tip: Selects all elements that are disabled.

:enabled.tip: Selects all elements that are enabled.

:focus.tip: Selects element if it is currently focused.

:file.tip: Selects all elements of type file.

:image.tip: Selects all elements of type image.

:input.tip: Selects all input, textarea, select and button elements.

:password.tip: Selects all elements of type password.

:radio.tip: Selects all elements of type radio.

:reset.tip: Selects all elements of type reset.

:selected.tip: Selects all elements that are selected.

:submit.tip: Selects all elements of type submit.

:text.tip: Selects all input elements of type text.

.attr().tip: Get the value of an attribute for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more attributes for every matched element.

.prop().tip: Get the value of a property for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more properties for every matched element.

.removeAttr().tip: Remove an attribute from each element in the set of matched elements.

.removeProp().tip: Remove a property for the set of matched elements.

.val().tip: Get the current value of the first element in the set of matched elements or set the value of every matched element.

.addClass().tip: Adds the specified class(es) to each element in the set of matched elements.

.css().tip: Get the value of a computed style property for the first element in the set of matched elements or set one or more CSS properties for every matched element.

jQuery.cssHooks.tip: Hook directly into jQuery to override how particular CSS properties are retrieved or set, normalize CSS property naming, or create custom properties.

.hasClass().tip: Determine whether any of the matched elements are assigned the given class.

.removeClass().tip: Remove a single class, multiple classes, or all classes from each element in the set of matched elements.

.toggleClass().tip: Add or remove one or more classes from each element in the set of matched elements, depending on either the class's presence or the value of the state argument.

.height().tip: Get the current computed height for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the height of every matched element.

.innerHeight().tip: Get the current computed inner height (including padding but not border) for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the inner height of every matched element.

.innerWidth().tip: Get the current computed inner width (including padding but not border) for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the inner width of every matched element.

.outerHeight().tip: Get the current computed height for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding, border, and optionally margin. Returns a number (without "px") representation of the value or null if called on an empty set of elements.

.outerWidth().tip: Get the current computed width for the first element in the set of matched elements, including padding and border.

.width().tip: Get the current computed width for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the width of every matched element.

.offSet().tip: Get the current coordinates of the first element, or set the coordinates of every element, in the set of matched elements, relative to the document.

.offsetParent().tip: Get the closest ancestor element that is positioned.

.scrollLeft().tip: Get the current coordinates of the first element in the set of matched elements, relative to the offset parent.

.scrollTop().tip: Get the current vertical position of the scroll bar for the first element in the set of matched elements or set the vertical position of the scroll bar for every matched element.

jQuery.data().tip: Store arbitrary data associated with the specified element and/or return the value that was set.

.data().tip: Store arbitrary data associated with the matched elements or return the value at the named data store for the first element in the set of matched elements.

jQuery.removeData().tip: Determine whether an element has any jQuery data associated with it.

.removeData().tip: Remove a previously-stored piece of data.

.clone().tip: Create a deep copy of the set of matched elements.

.wrap().tip: Wrap an HTML structure around each element in the set of matched elements.

.wrapAll().tip: Wrap an HTML structure around all elements in the set of matched elements.

.wrapInner().tip: Wrap an HTML structure around the content of each element in the set of matched elements.
